title: I just fucking cant anymore
body:
One week i get literally 5 fucking pentas climb from 0lp b5 to 60lp b4 at 10lp a fucking win and losing plenty of games inbetween because of tards bringing me down.

And then the next its just 10 straight fucking losses where its full of unwinnable teams?

I mean fucking hell the last team i had i was 1/2 against the enemy zed and said "hey shyvana could i get a gank zeds got a bit of a lead on me here and id appreciate getting the lane stable again" the response? well i died 5 times literally under my tower because zed got so fed off farm that he zoned me hard enough that i was lucky to get 1 cs from a wave and hed 2 shot me if i got ballsy enough to try to take cs, so it was just a waiting game for his flash or ult to come up.

Never got ganked once.

And then i was blamed for feeding.

You made a mistake riot, when you made league about teamwork, because people are fucking selfish and wont work as a team, i can see it working in ranked 5's where its 5 people who know each other and have team dynamic, but solo queue seriously start balancing the game around individual skill or atleast find a way to measure individual skill into the mmr system, i cant tell you the number of times i have literally spoon fed a win to a team that didnt deserve it, then turned around to take all my hard earned lp and mmr away because i became the officially sanctioned driver of the short bus, next stop retardville.

Like fuck man the ranked system is not fun, it feels like its 1 step forward 2 steps back, ill win ten games in a row by hard carrying feel great about myself, wake up the next day and lose 15, and if you try to tell me i magically got worse then seriously, fuck right off.

replies.body:
Your example with the enemy Zed can be looked at differently.

Instead of blaming your lost lane on no Shyvana gank, you can look at yourself more. How did you get in the situation where Zed was zoning you hard? Surely you could have played things differently as to avoid at least some of the 5 deaths to Zed under tower, as you say. What could you have done better? What did the enemy Zed do right? Perhaps you can learn from what your enemy did that was effective and apply it to your future games.

Sure, it may be partially the jungler's fault that they didn't help your lane and you lost. But ultimately your laning phase is your responsibility. Accept that you lost and sucked and need to improve.

> [{quoted}](name=Jonius7,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=nuH3QEr0,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-10-18T00:30:01.318+0000)
> But ultimately your laning phase is your responsibility. Accept that you lost and sucked and need to improve.

As long as any bronze does not do the part above, s/he will be stuck at that elo.

Yellowbrickroad will never look critically at his own game. Every single mistake is someone else's fault.

It's because he gets pentas sometimes. That means he's so much better than everyone else in the game. Because penta is skilz

or you could setup the lane to be ganked since honestly across most elos, junglers (aside from a few very bad ones) will generally pay a visit to any lane that's overextended towards their side. That said if shyvanna isn't going to gank that's unfortunate but I guess you could ask for a roam from another lane, like as mid ask for a top or sup roam; or as top ask for a mid roam.

I got into that situation because Zed went in for a hard engage at level 2 and we traded kills i got first blood he got a regular kill, he came back to lane with a serated dirk i came back to lane with a codex boots and a pink.

Combined with his w and the fact i only had about 40 armor at the time this allowed him to literally one shot me by simply w-ing, q-ing then flash ignite, that was death number 2.

from that point i informed shyvana i would need help as zed has a gold lead and my lane would be difficult to win now without assistance, keyword here is help, i didnt want shyvana to win my lane for me, just make the gold gap a little less than 3 waves of cs and a kill since thats alot of gold.

I proceeded to stand UNDER tower about in line with it csing with my q when and where i could, which wasnt very often at all, all the time begging for some bloody assistance.

Every time i went forward even a slight amount to cs a minion slightly out of q range i would get shadow q'd into a ult e'd then blow up because im dead at that point.

How would you play that lane different?

Cant roam bot because if i go bot so is zed and that just means he will get a triple, cant ask for ganks since the shy doesnt want to, infact not only does she not gank when she does arrive at the lane she pushes the wave into zeds tower then leaves forcing me to sit outside of experience range just to not die so zed ended up with a massive xp lead aswell.

There is literally, NOTHING i could do.

The only thing i could change, was playing that first blood slightly better so he didnt have the gold for a dirk.

So please, tell me it was my fault, when i did literally everything i could to stop zed snowballing.

> [{quoted}](name=YellowBrickRoad,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=nuH3QEr0,comment-id=00030002,timestamp=2016-10-19T19:45:52.104+0000)
>
> I got into that situation because Zed went in for a hard engage at level 2 and we traded kills i got first blood he got a regular kill, he came back to lane with a serated dirk i came back to lane with a codex boots and a pink.
> 
> Combined with his w and the fact i only had about 40 armor at the time this allowed him to literally one shot me by simply w-ing, q-ing then flash ignite, that was death number 2.

well hurray !!! 
you bought the WRONG ITEM and lost ... maybe admit it .?. 

against Zed and AD assissins you usually take {{item:3191}} first, or at least its ingredients ... even if you lost the trade and you think that you will get outfarmed and zone, there still IS a solution to at least passively gain gold and hp back and it is this : {{item:3301}} 

what, no guide tell you that it is worth taking .?. maybe think a bit on the itemization for yourself .?. you have almost 1000 ranked games for crying out loud ... 
 
> I proceeded to stand UNDER tower about in line with it csing with my q when and where i could, which wasnt very often at all, all the time begging for some bloody assistance.
> 
> Every time i went forward even a slight amount to cs a minion slightly out of q range i would get shadow q'd into a ult e'd then blow up because im dead at that point.
> 
> How would you play that lane different?

so, now you know at least TWO different ideas for that lane which would have gone a lot better than fiendish codex and if a good midlaner cared to comment I am sure you'd have more suggestions ... 

> There is literally, NOTHING i could do.

so, yes there was ... 

> So please, tell me it was my fault, when i did literally everything i could to stop zed snowballing.

and yes it was ...

Your assumption that i follow guides is cute, i stopped following guides before i even started playing ranked.

The reason why i dont buy zhonyas is because its a double edged sword, sure your invicible, but you also lose control of your character for the duration.

I can understands its use in higher elo's where you have a reliable team, and can reliably get the same result from correct usage.

But in bronze? im just as likely to e q w ult zhonyas and get the kill, as i am to e q w ult zhonyas and have my team run away from the fight randomly and then die as the enemy team collapses on me.

In other words i dont want to take control of my actions away from myself unless absolutely necessary, thats why i run armor per level instead of just flat armor, because im itemizing around not having zhonyas.

As for the ancient coin, sure ok i can understand that, but the passive hp gen is useless when you are being 100-0'd so basically to be gold efficient the price of the item would have to be worth 5 cdr and the passive gold gain, so basically to break even id have to stand under tower and not last hit ever for 350 / 4 x 6, lets say 6.25 to account for cannon waves, thats uh 14 waves, now if i was to sell the coin i could chunk off 140 gold so 210 / 4 x 6.25 which is 8.4 waves which with minion spawn timers being 30 seconds thats 4 and a half minutes.

Just to break even, not to gain gold, to break even.

And thats assuming during those 4 and a half minutes i never back once, i never last hit once, i never die once. i basically have to afk for 4 and a half minutes, just to make the item gold efficient.

Thats why i dont buy it.

Maybe YOU Should think about itemization if you honestly think that was a good suggestion.
Maybe don't engage as akali. Maybe use zhonya to block zeds ult. Maybe don't complain about being burst 100 to 0 after telling us you refuse to buy the exact item that would keep that from happening.

> [{quoted}](name=YellowBrickRoad,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=nuH3QEr0,comment-id=0003000200000000,timestamp=2016-10-22T00:44:25.305+0000)
>
> In other words i dont want to take control of my actions away from myself unless absolutely necessary, thats why i run armor per level instead of just flat armor, because im itemizing around not having zhonyas.

In other words you prefer to go 100 to zero % hp by the opponent's burst than buy a defensive item, but you still complain ... 
 
> And thats assuming during those 4 and a half minutes i never back once, i never last hit once, i never die once. i basically have to afk for 4 and a half minutes, just to make the item gold efficient.
> 
> Thats why i dont buy it.

/facepalm ... the coin is there to offset the minions you LOSE due to zoning, not to revert to a strategy of totally abstaining from CSing ... you are not a support ... the stats and the hp regen are the icing on the cake to make the item efficient and worth buying in the first place ...

I dont think you understand, the item isnt free.

To make back the cost of the item, i have to afk for 4 and a half minutes.

Im not saying thats what i need to make the item worth it, im saying if i dont do that, and sell the item before that, or take cs before that, then i actually lose gold, and i wouldve had more gold by not buying it in the first place.

Learn to math.

or in other words, i actually get more gold by not buying the item and getting 1-2 cs per wave.

Then i do if i bought the item and did the same thing.

Because again the item costs 350 gold, which is about 18 cs so 3 waves.

Or 14 waves worth of its own passive.

And ill repeat myself a third time to really drive it home.

The item, COSTS 8 waves worth of gold, to be gold efficient if you sell it after the 8 waves.

If you DONT sell the coin the item costs 14 WAVES of not csing or backing before you make even 1 gold off the item.

To put it in real world terms, the ancient coin is like stocks that pay dividends.

You buy a $350 share in stocks.

And you get $24 in dividends every year.

That means it would take 14.6 years to make a profit, now you could those stocks after 7.3 years when the shares have gone down 50% and you would break even, you didnt make any money but you also didnt lose money either.

Same shit with ancient coin, you are buying a 350 gold item, so to calcuate its worth you have to start with a value, of -350,  not 0.

And thats where you are getting tripped up you are thinking "well i buy it and it makes me gold" but no, it doesnt make you gold, unless you stand near the deaths of 52 cs without taking it, it doesnt pay itself off. if you do stand near 52 cs without killing it? the item makes you 2 gold, literally 2 gold. if you hit 2 cs of every 6 in that 44 you wouldve made 210 gold assuming a gold value of 15.

So basically last hitting 2 minions and only 2 minions of every wave, makes more gold than ancient coin period, it doesnt pay off unless you keep the item wayyyy into the late game and miss shit tons of cs.

I can give more specific tips, but a few months ago you posted a rant post about how your games were being ruined by smurfs and I already posted some lengthy replies there. I will reiterate something though. This tip, with enough practice will get you out of B5 and into at least B3 and not fall back!

Focus on objectives. Get those turrets down!
Having this in your mind also helps fix a few other problems: you will go for less pointless teamfights, because you realise there is no objective to be taken. It will also help reduce pointless deaths. it will also give you something to focus on that consistently helps you win games. Kills don't necessarily do that.

That's all I can really say for now.

Dude seriously, look at my name, take a guess which champion i mained for 6 months in season 5 on my other account before making this one.

Starts with S.

His only gameplay is pushing towers.

Ends with inged.

Yes i play assasins, but notice every assassin i play i make sure to include atleast one item that makes pushing towers easier? hell people scoff at my lich bane on kat, till they see the 10/2 kat solo push inhib tower in 5 seconds because shes 4 hitting the tower with lich bane procs, my ENTIRE game is pushing towers, every kill i get in every game is litearlly on the way to an objective, or in a teamfight where im attempting to ace or take out the main threats so i can push even harder.

That advice is useless to me when i already do that.

What i need to learn is how to convince the rest of my team to do that.

Thats why i started playing assassins, bronzies only seem to care about kills.

So if i use what little mechanics i have to be the most fed person on the team, maybe they will listen for once.

If you lose 2 games in a row, stop playing ranked for that day, or at least a couple hours. Losing 15 games in a day sounds like an exaggeration, but tilt is a major factor in play performance. Have a break from LoL for a couple hours, run around outside, play a different game, or even play ARAM for the fun of it.

Playing ranked when tilting is easily the best way to lose LP tho

I was going to suggest something like taking a break after a couple losses but you beat me to it! ; ) 

Everyone goes through downward spirals, that thing when we're compelled to win that one game... _just that one game..._ which often never comes. We start to blame all sorts of things and convince ourselves it's not our fault. Nevertheless, we trudge on and on and on until we've lost all our progress and feel like writing a thread like this one.

YellowBrick, we all know how it feels. You gotta try draw the line somewhere. Hell, I know it ain't easy but it's the only way to keep your sanity 'round these parts.

Tbh alot of my issue is ive been paying attention to my winrate lately, like for instance im currently at a 29 game delta to 50% and it pisses me off knowing that fluctuating between 30 games and 20 games means even 1 loss is about 0.1% on my winrate, so if i lose even one game from a bad teammate/s i tilt 290 degrees.

I know I probably shouldn't have but I've been tracking my win/loss, among other things (like promo series attempts), in an excel spreadsheet. It was interesting at first when it was just a way to visualise my progress but after getting stuck in the same rank for over 100 games it turned into something closer to _data of shame_. Honestly, seeing that red number stack up after every failed promo series really hurt but I couldn't stop trying and hoping I'd get there. If I had drawn the line sooner I may have been able to refocus and had a more productive season but who knows.

In low elo you must carry the team.
In order to do so, you have to understand the limitation of your champion.
Main at least 1 champion. Learn how to master this champ from Hi elo streamers (Youtube / Twitch)

For the general tips and tricks,
Do warding, use the chat to organise team, use the pings, and mute if necessary.
You can also ask for a coach to teach you many general things. Ask around in this forum for any coach. Most of them were at low elo before and can understand your situation.

If you want, you can also add me. I don't mind sharing tips and tricks about playing this game.
I was at Bronze rank for the first 2 years playing this game.
Now I am at Gold.
I main top / mid.

Here's a poro to cheer you up {{summoner:31}}

Im a mastery 7 akali and kat both with over 100 games (this season on this account) and multiple pentas quads and hundreds of triples (again only this season on this account more last season and on my other accounts).

i have a pretty good understanding of the champs much better than the typical bronzie atleast, so lets scratch off that first advice.

I usually ward more than the support, unless they build a sightstone but even then sometimes they still suck at warding and i outward them, so lets ignore that one as well.

Use chat to organise? have you played in bronze, like seriously THEY DONT LISTEN.

Pings? see previous statement of not listening.

If a coach can teach me how to get my team to follow instructions and improve my mechanics sure, my macro play could use a tiny bit of work as well but the mere fact i even understand Kills=/=Win already puts me miles ahead of bronze players.

> [{quoted}](name=YellowBrickRoad,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=nuH3QEr0,comment-id=00050001,timestamp=2016-10-19T19:57:17.271+0000)
>
> Im a mastery 7 akali and kat both with over 100 games (this season on this account) and multiple pentas quads and hundreds of triples (again only this season on this account more last season and on my other accounts).

All of that stuff is meaningless ... look at your profile : 

http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=YellowBrickRoad

look at the red parts carefully : 

http://oi66.tinypic.com/34zzkea.jpg

this is objectively horrible ... you average 8 deaths per game, you tank more damage with squishy/carry champions than the tanks in a game, your maximum deaths in ALL those champions are above 14 ( O_o ) your farm is in bronze level and you tell us that **"my macro play could use a tiny bit of work as well"**

dude, for real .?. :) 

> i have a pretty good understanding of the champs much better than the typical bronzie atleast, so lets scratch off that first advice.

no, you do not and playing 65 different champions in ranked games does not mean that you understand how they are played, but that you do not understand that you do not know how they are played.
 
> Use chat to organise? have you played in bronze, like seriously THEY DONT LISTEN.

and you do .?. 
according to some other answers you have created similar topics in the past, but you do not follow their advice ... 

> If a coach can teach me how to get my team to follow instructions and improve my mechanics sure, my macro play could use a tiny bit of work as well but the mere fact i even understand Kills=/=Win already puts me miles ahead of bronze players.

your macro game needs tons of work and saying that you understand Kills=/=Win is vastly different from ACTUALLY understanding it ... when you have so many average deaths, such proclamations are ludicrous ...

My games go for 40 minutes, statistically i will die atleast once, if not multiple times.

I have no doubt if challenger games didnt end in the first 30 minutes that people would die alot more, the difference though being challenger games have a much higher focus on the macro play than the micro.

Sure you could go teamfight (bronze play)

Or you know, you could just not? and go push that tower and end the game instead.

The issue is when the other 4 players arent on the same page when it comes to pushing you have two choices, split that tower and get ambushed (warding ofc helps here but doesnt completely negate it) and most likely die, unless you are snowballing hard *cough* hence why i play the champions i do, snowball *cough*

Or you can go help the teamfight and hope to get an ace to allow you to safely push.

Neither of which will end games quickly.

Do you get what im saying?

Like fuck man want more proof, there is a direct correlation between how much i die, and how much my team dies, legit go analyse my match history youve already started, but look at EVERYONES scores not just mine.

The games where i die a vast number of times, look at the adc, or the top, or i dunno the jg, you will notice i have a fraction of their deaths?

Wheres the correlation? im glad you asked, what you then need to do is look at the enemy team, a pattern you will quickly notice is atleast one of the enemies is snowballing hard.

So where do my deaths usually come from? that person, the snowballing one.

its literally that simple, infact i die like once, maybe twice tops in lane phase on average, its not until mid to late where its either teamfight or get 4 maned that i start dying.

Now what could i do there? oh i could stop the snowball, if i could split myself into 3 people and go to each lane and camp them, usually if an enemy player is snowballing i class them on my own level, bronze, but not a bronze thinker, as such you damn well they arent going to be ganking anywhere near where i can respond if they have vision of me, why do i say that? because id do the same thing in their position.

> [{quoted}](name=YellowBrickRoad,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=nuH3QEr0,comment-id=0005000100010000,timestamp=2016-10-22T00:24:18.661+0000)
>
> My games go for 40 minutes, statistically i will die atleast once, if not multiple times.

Multiple times does not mean that you should be dying on average more than 8 times per game, like you do ...

> I have no doubt if challenger games didnt end in the first 30 minutes that people would die alot more, the difference though being challenger games have a much higher focus on the macro play than the micro.

Who compared you with challenger players .?. You know that people do get out of bronze and without actually having your abysmal death ratio (or actually because they do not have that ratio ... )

> Sure you could go teamfight (bronze play)

it is a team game, you know ... 

> Or you know, you could just not? and go push that tower and end the game instead.

oh yeah, go splitpush while the opponents are wrecking your team 4 vs 5 ... splitpushing is a valid strategy one very rare and specific times ... 

> Or you can go help the teamfight and hope to get an ace to allow you to safely push.
> Neither of which will end games quickly.
> Do you get what im saying?

No, I do not ... acing the opponents does lead to ending the game quickly, more often than not ... 
 
> Like fuck man want more proof, there is a direct correlation between how much i die, and how much my team dies, legit go analyse my match history youve already started, but look at EVERYONES scores not just mine.
> The games where i die a vast number of times, look at the adc, or the top, or i dunno the jg, you will notice i have a fraction of their deaths?
> Wheres the correlation? im glad you asked, what you then need to do is look at the enemy team, a pattern you will quickly notice is atleast one of the enemies is snowballing hard.
> So where do my deaths usually come from? that person, the snowballing one.

You are just full of excuses and that only keep you down there in bronze ... oh, really someone else is snowballing eh .?. I though you said that you are the snowballer on your team, but if YOU die so much, then there goes the teamfight potential, the team crumbles and you lose the game in one of those fights which you claimed that do not speed up the game ... 

so, you think that only in YOUR games an opponent is snowballing and that we should "check the opponents" .?. Ok, fair enough, let us say that an opponent is snowballing ... isn't it **YOUR JOB** to avoid getting wrecked by him and survive .?. If you are losing to him, then you are getting outplaying, **ergo there is room for improvement** ... 

let me prove it to you, not with my stats because that would have been unfair (I play tanks), but the stats of a friend who usually plays immobile adcs : 

http://oi65.tinypic.com/f2ub9d.jpg

**and these are YOUR stats :**

http://oi67.tinypic.com/2cmu44l.jpg

**notice any difference .?.**  is he "lucky" .?. no, he is not ... he just knows how and were to position himself in the fights and play safe and take objectives without giving gold to the opponents ... all I am saying is that instead of going **"I am AWESOME"** and filling your mind with excuses, you should be thinking **"hey, I can improve"** and do something about it ... 

do note that the person in my example is NOT mechanically a good player, which stands true for myself as well ... this is irrelevant though, since LoL is a TEAMGAME and as long as you fulfill your role and you play better than your counterparts (thus bringing more to the table for YOUR team, than what your opponents), you will eventually rise in the ladder ... 
 
> its literally that simple, infact i die like once, maybe twice tops in lane phase on average, its not until mid to late where its either teamfight or get 4 maned that i start dying.

so, what .?. deaths are deaths and during the late game it is where one errant death might mean a free baron for the opponents and the defeat of your team ... you can go 0-3 in laning and not even lose a tower, and die once in late game and lose the whole game ... 
 
> Now what could i do there? oh i could stop the snowball, if i could split myself into 3 people and go to each lane and camp them, 

**maybe stop playing "snowballers" and start playing champions that can impact the TEAM as a whole .?. **

I am certain that you will not heed anything in it, but hey, at least I will be able to say that I tried ... 

http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/88ATNtFV-guide-how-to-get-out-of-bronzesilver-tier-season-6-version

that way I got two accounts out of bronze with solo games, in 16 in the first one (after the placements) and 19 games for the second one ... I also took my other account from Silver V to gold V with 133 games. 

that is about 5 times LESS games than you took to remain stuck in bronze V ... so, either get off your "I am awesome" high horse and heed other people's advice in this and previous topics and **get better OR stay where you currently belong and quit nagging about your teammates** ...

Im not gonna address the other shit because you are just turning into a more thought out fattyhotdogs.

But i would like to point out a contradiction.

is it a team game or not?

Because its awfully convenient to say everything that goes wrong is my fault, and then turn around and say that i should prop my team up.

So really which is it, either its a teamgame and the fact that my team as a whole makes stupid calls is a problem that i cant fix personally and forces me to play snowball or split pushing champions.

Or its a not a team game and i cant blame my team, but that also exempts me from needing to help my team.

But actually no you will dodge that question because you cant fucking spin it to make me look bad.

Actually you can you are probably gonna say something like "well thats a shitty attitude to have" its not shitty its realistic.

Like if i see that There is an open bottom inhib tower and the enemy team is currently pushing top t2 tower who is correct here.

Me for wanting to go take that tower while the enemy team takes a less important tower.

or my team, for wanting to go teamfight to save the t2.

Because yes, thats what fucking happens in bronze.

I could give less shits if my team is made up of nothing but faker, or if mechanically they are all potatos.

but if they treat the fucking game like a ticket match where kills make some invisible counter go down to the win.

Then im gonna fucking blame them for the loss, because it is their fucking fault.

its their fucking fault for not pushing towers.

its their fucking fault for deciding risking their lives for a few kills was worth  it.

its their fucking fault for calling baron and ignoring my pleas to not fucking baron with 4 of the enemy team up and all our lanes pushing towards us.

If that sounds general to you, good, because what i think when i think of bronze, thats my general experience, 9/10 if i boot up a game, atleast ONE of those things will happen, if not more.

And unless im some fucking psychic god thats remotely controlling these shits stains pc's with my mind, none of that can be pinned on me.

Infact the only way that could be blamed on me, is that im not a good enough retard wrangler to whip these tards into line.

Now dont fucking reply unless you have something worthwhile to say that i havnt heard 50 times already.

> [{quoted}](name=YellowBrickRoad,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=nuH3QEr0,comment-id=000500010001000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-24T08:51:05.220+0000)
>
> Im not gonna address the other shit because you are just turning into a more thought out fattyhotdogs.

you seem to be missing a very important point here ... people giving you their time to HELP YOU are not doing it so that you can trash talk them as a "reward" ... I am not going to waste any more precious time to help someone that does not want to listen, but just wants to nag ... 

**YOU** are in Bronze V, not any of the people trying to help you, so it is **YOUR problem** ... 

> Because its awfully convenient to say everything that goes wrong is my fault 

Can you quote a place where I claim such a thing .?. 
 
> But actually no you will dodge that question because you cant fucking spin it to make me look bad.

I do not have to "spin" something that I never claimed ... things are really simple ... if YOU are better than the person playing the same positions as you in the opposing team, sooner or later you will climb, because you are bringing more worth/value to your team.

So yes, getting better as a SOLO player, makes your TEAM better as well ... obviously ... so, what exactly is the mystery here .?.
 
> Then im gonna fucking blame them for the loss, because it is their fucking fault.

> If that sounds general to you, good, because what i think when i think of bronze, thats my general experience, 9/10 if i boot up a game, atleast ONE of those things will happen, if not more.

Do so and stay Bronze V ... not our problem ... do you realise that most of us have indeed played in bronze and got out of there .?. We know how the games are down there, you do not have to tell us ...

No you dont know.

You knew what bronze was like X number of seasons ago.

But heres a crazy concept for you, as more and more of the good players climb out, then a much higher percentage of the players left over will be those "unwinnable" teams.

Ive played league since 2009, i may not have played ranked till season 5 but ive been here since the start on various accounts.

I can tell you first hand, the longer the game is live, the worse the lowest ranking players get.

Hell look at me season 5 compared to s6, i was b2 last season and on the cusp of escaping bronze.

So why am i stuck in b5 this season?

Only 2 explanations, either i somehow got worse.

Or the people around me got worse.

One of those two has a reasonable explanation behind it (more good players climbed out than the number of bad players falling back into bronze)

The other is just an explanation that has to exist to justify the problem, infact arguably i have improved my play since last season, my csing is up, my deaths are down, my kills are up, my objective contributions are up etc etc, im better than last season across the board, but my ranking performance is down.

That one fact goes against everything you are trying to tell me.

Which is why i ignore it.

because every time you mention statistical averages or imply such things the first fucking thing you forget about.

Is statistical outliers.

Is it probable that i can be stuck in bronze and not play like a bronze? no its not probable.

is it possible though? well if im a statistical outlier then yes actually.

Not to mention the fact that as i mentioned again the skill delta in the lowest ranks of league has been steadily decreasing each season, a great example of this in action is if you take a diamond/plat player who has not playing in bronze for many season and say "win every game in bronze until you hit silver" they cant do it.

people have tried and they cant do it.

The only people who can are those that regularly smurf in bronze or have recently been in bronze, and thats not a matter of skill, thats a matter of knowing the mindset of bronze players of the current season and exploiting the most common mistakes made, which in itself is a skill, but a skill that is developed with trial and error and not by being better at league.

And again because you are a fattyhotdogs clone who thinks his statements out a little more, im going to guess your next comment would be something along the lines of "well if you are one of the statistical outliers like you say, why cant you climb then, it should be easy, i did it"

And thatd be a good question, if you asked it of anyone else they would be stumped, but luckily i know exactly why i dont climb.

One word answer.

Tilt.

it is literally that simple, if i dont play league for 2 weeks ill come back win 10 games in a row and over those 10 games my performance will slowly decrease game after game until finally i start losing.

Now you could attribute that to my mmr increasing, except my mmr is currently so low that i can win 30 games in a row and still be matched with exactly the same people, which means the only variable for my performance decreasing in that scenario can be myself.

Which then asks the question, why does my performance decrease over the period of a dozen or so games, it cant be magic there has to be a logical solution.

And this is the reason why i blame my teams, im not saying they make me lose directly, ill repeat myself again and again i could give less shits if they are the worst players in the world, if im in a good mood and im not getting trashed in lane i will solo carry them, 9/10.

The real reason i blame my teams is i cannot deal, with idiots.

Plain and simple, you put a dumb %%%% in front of me, and ill sit there thinking to myself "how the fuck do you even function, and why the fuck are you alive, you shouldn't be allowed to breed because that would just cause further damage to the gene pool"

Some people have that opinion because they are edgy memelords, i fucking believe it.

I honestly believe that this enablist society has bred a generation of complete utter fuckwits that can barely tie their own shoes.

And im in the mmr where they all bloody congregate, great if im not tilted because i can hard carry a game while watching a tv show (which btw is how i play half the time, not even paying attention to the game)

Terrible if i notice them making stupid decisions because it puts me in a spiral of tilt.

Because unlike other elos where its just one team that tilts you, ALL my teams tilt me.

In fact its a breath of fresh air when i reach the end of a game, win or lose, carry or dont carry, and am not tilted.

Like fucking hell the days where im not tilted? i usually end up getting my mains banned out for the next few hours, its literally that big a difference.

And none of your advice will help me with tilt, none of it.

None of your statements, none of your tips, nada.

I was bronze 4 this very season. Tell me I don't know what bronze is like ay? 
And no. You are not a statistical outlier. Somebody that plays as many games as you do is not a statistical outlier. In fact if you wanna employ the word statistical, then statistically the larger your sample size, the more average you are. And you have a very large sample size bro. 
If tilt is the reason you are still bronze 5, then stop playing when you are tilted. Obviously you will stop losing and you will climb. There, you know the tool to climb. Go use it

Id be more than open to some tips from a more experienced akali main, especially as with the upcoming rework my "signature" gunblade+2 ad items builds is rip (2 ad items because of the 50% spellvamp (35%+gunblade) from the ad and with the amount of ap i get its usually around an extra 300-400 magic damage on autos that can hit towers)

The main thing i think people forget whenever they bitch about me bitching *cough* fattyhotdogs *cough* is that, i play snowball champs.

The first rule of snowballing is to capitalise on enemies mistakes, if i am aware of and able to abuse the mistakes of the enemy team, would that not logically mean i am aware of when i make those same mistakes? which is why i get pissed whenever people try to tell me i dont admit to making mistakes, its not that i cant see them, its that i literally dont make them, infact i abuse them, does that mean there are mistakes i make that i wont admit to? fuck no i just dont see those exact mistakes, and tbh if i knew of them i wouldnt make them either and id snowball even harder because itd give me even more tools to abuse.

If you literally don't make any mistakes, then stop dying and losing. Legit find me one person in the world that will believe you don't make mistakes

Also, find me anyone in gold + that would claim to not make mistakes. I challenge you

Spectate your own replay game.

Take note of any better things that you can do, learn from it.

The rule is never gank a losing line as the enemy could kill both if already fed. You need to stay behind tower to cs and let the jungler help a winning lane to balance the game. learn and get gid

i was behind tower, did you even read the post?

And 2/1 is not fed to the point where a gank is impossible.

tbh when I play and I'm even slightly behind in lane I generally tell the jungler to stay away from my lane. More often than not, my jungler will just make a bad gank and end up feeding them more. Learning how to play defensive and stall out laning phase is an important skill too.
That said even as a farm jungler like shyvanna, that was probably a bad choice from her to leave the lane snowballing against you. 

Even though I main support, when I'm jungler I'm pretty confident I can gank a lane so long as they aren't 0-4 but I generally won't go to a lane unless it's almost even or pushed to my laners side. Towerdives are generally not worth it in lower elo unless you can get the tower or another objective for the time it could take and the risk.

Interesting note is that if your support seems confident and is doing okay in botlane, alot of us support mains wouldn't mind roaming mid inbetween adc backs, if you can coordinate to make use of us and you tell us you want a support roam. Not to mention I find support roams tilt midlaners harder than jungler roams by 500%. A cheeky exhaust+cc+little bit of damage goes a long way to winning the midlaner 1v1.
Inconsistent play imagine that.
